It's a great place to people watch the folks on their way to get some ice cream, biking through Hayes Valley, and even families in that makeshift playground. 

We got the banana knot, and it was delicious - a pretzel with honey and banana (and maybe something else that I can't recall right now). It was delicious!
 
The best part - everyone really just seems like they are having a great time!
author: Su P.

description: I enjoyed my visit here yesterday for a very sunny Friday afternoon.  My friends and I weren't the only ones who finished their day early and decided to head here, however- seating was like a wrestling match and the line for beers is ridiculous, bordering on 30+ minutes.  Contrasted with absolutely NO line for their food, there is clearly an organizational/logistical/operational problem which this place needs to tackle in order to maximize their clearly popular concept.  The beer was great, the pretzels we chowed on were awesome- but the line and crowd will scare me off.  30 or more minutes in line for a $12 liter of beer? Sorry guys, fix this or I'll find somewhere else to blow my cash...
author: Andy S.

description:
Great idea, and the beer is authentic..as is the food. 

Issue is that there aren't enough points-of-sale...lines were RIDICULOUS  last night, to the point we ended up sharing our liters and heading elsewhere so we could actually buy drinks.  

Definitely much better in the afternoon - after 7pm, I'd avoid unless they get more taps and registers.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Cool Concept (5stars) + Long long long long line for beer and food (2stars) + Only 3 beer choices (3stars) + Girl dispensing beer didn't go a good job, half of stein was head (2stars) + Delicious Sauerkraut (5stars) + Pricey food (3stars) + hard to find coed Porta-potty (1star) = somehow this averages to 3 stars!

BTW, is anyone willing to go here on a rainy day???
author: Jen C.

description:
O-ver-ra-ted! *clap-clap-clapclapclap*

Biergarten does not suck.  But there are better restaurants and bars for ambience, beer selection/quality, and food quality that don't have the:
  *long waits (plural: long wait to get in, long waits for beers/food)
  *high prices
that make Biergarten very avoidable.

Staff are cool, as were the most of the other patrons.
author: David P.

description:
This place just opened so I'm cutting them some slack because: 
1.) I love the concept and applaud them for getting this off  the ground 
2.) I think they will work out the kinks 
3.) I hope this will create opportunities for more restaurants/bars like this one

We arrived right at 3pm when the Biergarten opened and waited in line for about 30 minutes to get in, then waited another 20-30 minutes for a beer and a pretzel.  Kind of a long wait, but the place is new and I'm hoping they will work out a better way to handle the flow of people in/out/serving beers.

The staff was beyond friendly and a bit apologetic about getting things going with the new space.  Totally understandable.  The beers were big and delicious and the pretzels really hit the spot.  I did not have a sausage, but will definitely go back for one.  

It's not uber cheap (two giant beers came to approx. $21) but I guess that's just what giant beers go for in Hayes Valley.  

The atmosphere is still a little bleak - it's basically a chain link fence around a parking lot with picnic tables and a few trees for shade.  However, it looks like vines are being grown on the fence and the trees will fill out.  Lots of potential!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

Hayes Valley has been waiting for you Biergarten!

Came here after work on one of those "70 degrees and sunny" days in San Francisco. I should have been prepared for this since I've heard so many great things, but this place was PACKED. We waited on a very long line to get our beers, but luckily while waiting on line you are able to scout out possible seats. I luckily spied two open spots at a crowded table and we swooped in. The beers are your typical german beers, but something about having them outside, under market-lights,  with a hundred other people some how makes them tastier. 

But beware! When the temperature drops this place gets chilllly. Which is why they have blankets. Which I am a BIG fan of.
author: Melissa N.

description: This place is pretty good if you are looking for a laid-back spot during the day. If you are trying to rage then I probably wouldn't recommend coming here. Biggest reason being that they only serve beer- meaning no hard alc. So if you are trying to get rowdy then I would probably recommend Tipsy Pig or Brickyard to fulfill those needs. Anyways, the line here gets pretty long so I think if you can get there before it opens and get in line then that would probably be your best bet. If you are with a group of friends and looking to sit somewhere outside then this is definitely a cool spot as long as it isn't too windy outside. Personally, I think the Marina is more my scene but if you want a more chill place then Biergarten might be your go to!
author: Neilu A.

description: This place is sooo fun! If you have not been yet, just go! It's literally a fenced in concrete area with a bunch of picnic tables and old shipping containers used as the vendor stands. Do not be alarmed, there may be a very long line to enter, but it moves a lot faster than you would expect. The beer is all so fresh and delectable. It is hard not to drink it so fast because it is so refreshing. There is a large assortment and varying sizes to choose from. I think my hubby chose liters. Aside from the beer, the pretzels are also delicious. Yum! I've heard the rest of the food is great as well. In addition to the eating and drinking, this is also the perfect spot to meet all sorts of people. Since long picnic tables are your only seating option, chances are you'll be sharing with strangers. We were there about five hours and it never got old.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
A great interpretation of a real German biergarten. Good beer, tasty sausages and fixings. 

Minus one star for the chain link fence. I know this part of Hayes Valley is temporary, but, really, that was the best you could do?
author: Mark P.

description:
My cousin showed me the Yelp page for Biergarten and I tinged at the thought of going here. Hipsters. Cold SF weather. (insert something crummy about SF). Was I wrong!

When I got here with my cousin and her friend I was expecting the line to stretch out into the sidewalk but it didn't, so the wait time was very reasonable. Also keep an eye out for a space opening up so you can sit down with your glorious liter of beer. When I went to order, the person working the taps was very friendly and helped me choose a beer, even offering me if I wanted to try some to make sure I would like it. 

We all got a liter of Edelweiss and that was enjoyable. As for the food (I'm not sure if it was because I was hungry or not) we ordered the bratwurst with sauerkraut and that was pretty delish. Later we asked the server as he was cleaning up our trays what he would recommend. He said that the sliders (cow tongue and pork belly) were good. I was thrown off when he said cow tongue but I just bit the bullet and ate it. It was pretty delicious on my part. Never know unless you try...

I also saw the reviews for Biergarten and saw some contradicting things. The one review saying they couldn't get a knife? There were knifes and forks a plenty! When we ran out of napkins we flagged down a server and he put in more napkins in the cup where it was organized with the forks and knives. And I'm not sick from the food...

Although it was my first time there, some pro-tips to follow by the next time I go:
1. Dress in layers (SF weather can get really cold and windy in an instant).
2. If you start getting cold, they lend out blankets, but get them before they lend them all out! 
3. Just get the liter. Don't skimp out on yourself.
3. It'll probably be better to come on a "off" day, as in Wednesday or Thursday probably when they open up or later in the evening. I went on a Wednesday at around 6:30PM and it looked like it was dying out around 8PM ish.
4. GO WITH FRIENDS!!!
author: Brian L.

description:
One of the few true outdoor places to drink in the city to enjoy some nice bavarian brews. For the most part its a pretty legit beer garden with great beer decent small bites and a nice place to hipster watch. 

Their line system is of course, puts the TSA to shame. They really ought to fix that.
author: Aditya J.

description:
Go for the bier, stay for the outdoor drinking experience. But eat elsewhere. 

Let me explain...

The beer choices are good and you can get them in 1/2 or 1 Litre sizes, but you'll have to wait in a long line before getting to quench your thirst. The people taking your order are friendly, answer your questions, and don't rush you despite the line that keeps growing behind you (it takes a while to pour a litre of beer!).

Once you have your beer in hand, find a picnic table, kick back, and get merry.

And if you happen to get hungry, I'd visit the food trucks parked around the corner before buying food here again. On to the hugely disappointing snacks:
I was looking forward to having a nice, warm German pretzel. What I got in return for my $5 was a COLD seeded pretzel with dollops of mustard and nostril-searing horseradish. F that.

Still hungry, I ordered a brat & sauerkraut for $9. Tasty, but no bun so it wasn't as filling as I was hoping. Hey, at least the brat was hot. Still, $9 for a brat is kinda crazy. Is there a ballgame going on here? They must be made from organic, virgin, nitrite-free, vegan-diet pork to justify it.

Given their overhead (or lack thereof), I'd expect lower prices across the board. But since the crowds keep on coming, I doubt they'll change anything.
author: Patrick H.

description: A perfect place to spend the 5 sunny days we get per year in SF.  Unfortunately, when my friends and I came here in mid-July, it was overcast and cold.  The free blankets you can borrow definitely came in handy.  We arrived maybe half an hour after opening and it was already pretty crowded.  We did manage to snag seats.  As more and more people piled in, the beer line got a bit ridiculous such that a light-weight such as myself could sober up waiting to get to the front.  Okay, I exaggerate; the wait is just annoyingly long.  With the beer line that crazy, imagine the bathroom line!  Despite the wait and crowdedness, the beer is good and the food looked good.
author: Thi D.

description:
Imagine a small, cozy parking lot filled with picnic tables and people who serve you beer and food from repurposed shipping containers, and you have Biergarten.  Simple, no fuss, no frills.  Beer is limited to a handful of selections, but all of them are good, so no problems there.  Food was very tasty -- good sausages, excellent salads.  The pretzels aren't worth all the ranting and raving, but they're still good.

This place gets really popular really quick, especially on a nice day, so get here early or be prepared to wait.  I got here 30 minutes after opening and had to wait another 30 just to get my food.  Friends who joined us later had to wait even longer.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Fun!  ... with a few caveats.

First, get there within 45 minutes of it opening, which is at 2:00pm. After that time period, you're gonna be hovering over the tables like a hawk looking for a spot to rest your big ass steins. If you see a small bench spot, go ahead and ask to squeeze in. Most folks will be friendly enough to scooch a bit for you and your friends (hopefully it's just 1 or 2 only). 

I'd definitely spring for an entire 1L stein.  You think you'd only be game for half a liter... but chances are you're gonna be having a fun time chatting with your friends and sitting al fresco on a warm afternoon... you'll want to stay longer and drink more.  And it sucks majorly to have to line up again... guarantee another 30 min wait.  

Speaking of the wait... they need another person behind the taps! 2 cashiers can take the orders and 1 tap master can be dispensing the golden goodness.  This can hurry along the wait a lot faster.  But honestly, that'd probably fill this up really fast and there really isn't enough seats for such a big crowd.

As for the food... loved the bratwurst!  It comes with dijon mustard, horseradish that'll singe your nose hairs, and a giant heap of sauerkraut.  Though I was bit confused why it had sooo much liquid in the baskets it is served in.  That could be drained out a little better.  Brats are moist and flavorful.  The kraut was great!  I ate it like it was a side salad!

Deviled eggs were pickled in beet juice... gave it a unique sweet tang.  I added a goop of horseradish to balance it out.  Hoo wee!

Waitresses are really fast with serving the food and they're always coming around to pick up your empty dishes/glasses.  They either do that to replenish for the bar or they want to retrieve those back before it ends up in some TimBuk2 bag (yoink!).

Also, you will no doubt bust out your bad German accent during your stay here.  Auf Wiedersehen!
author: Chris T.

description:
Biergarten is a welcome outdoor space on those rare San Francisco sunny days. If you notice that the forecast is going to be nice over the weekend, plan to line up at Biergarten a bit before they are open so you can get a beer and a coveted spot at the communal tables while it is still warm.

 They don't open until 3pm so you only have about 2 hours of warm sun to enjoy out there. Not sure why they can't open at noon so we can all make the most of the sun and some lunch at Biergarten.

Right now the beer and ID checking lines just combine in to one looong very slow line. Just order the largest beer you can  because after you wait in that huge line once you will not want to wait in it again just to get another beer.

I have also tried the  beautiful pink deviled eggs and the pretzels with mustard and horseradish. both are excellent beer snacks. At least they have an extra line so you can pick up snacks without getting in the beer line. They don't have very many beers on tap, maybe 3, but you are really there for the atmosphere. For those looking for a lighter drink try the Radler, a lemon + beer shandy.
author: Leuwam T.

description:
Beer -- good but they ran out of one kind.  They only have 3 kinds!  Also, it was expensive.  The smaller size of beer (which is still plenty big) is $8.  The large size is $15.  

I shared a large beer with my boyfriend and a brat basket, which is two bratwursts and one "pretzel" (pretty small if you ask me) for $18.  Two hotdogs and a ball of bread for nearly $20?  Luckily we weren't too hungry.  I wouldn't order this dish again.  The sauerkraut was good . . . 

Best thing about this place is the outdoor tables.  It has cute white lights that brighten it up at night and give it a fun atmosphere.  It was pretty busy for a Wednesday when I went.  Crowd was late 20s.

I would go back here only for the beer, not for the food.  But it is a unique option when Suppenkuche is too busy to seat you.  And, they bring the food to the table (they give you a number when you order) which is a nice touch.
author: Carolyn N.

description:
Actual rating: 3.75 / 5 stars

This place is an awesome place to go to.... if you bring all your friends with you and drink lots of beer with lots of obnoxious people. Nice place, since it's closed off across a park with lot of good stores around. 

Don't get me wrong, the beer is awesome. They don't have a huge selection of beer, but whatever they do have is very good. The food here is expensive for a "food-truck" type of food, so try to come here not on an empty stomach. You shouldn't drink with an empty stomach anyway. I had the 2 sausages combo with pretzel for $18. The 1L beer is about $10. Sausages was ok, pretzel was good. Beer was excellent. 

So wear a jacket, layer, prepare to wait in line, bring lots of friend, come with good stories to tell and just be loud. Don't bring your date here. Unless it's a group thang and you like to talk to random groups of the same type of people.
author: Andrew I.

description:
Is pimpin' easy? hell ya! This place is awesome. Where else can you enjoy a Liter of gold alcoholic goodness in the sun? Awesome location with very helpful staff members. 

The food looks amazing, but I have yet to try the fair because I'm usually eating something else while waiting for this fine establishment to open. Almost clawing at the gate for them to open it. 

Maybe the benches could be a little more strategically placed that way some people are not sitting back to back (literally). 

oh and ps to the person who said they would rather go to Suppenkuche... they F'ing own biergarten.
author: Anthony D.

description: pretzels. brats. beer. Served in exactly the right environment for such. Happiness.
author: Mark N.

description: The food comes in small portions and is a bit pricey but Biergarten keeps you coming back with great atmosphere, a live band, and fun crowd. Please skip the egg sandwich and duck fat. Order the Pork Belly Sandwich along with a side of potato salad.  A thick cut of pork belly fat grilled brown and crispy is served on a warm mini bun. I could eat 6 of these pork belly sandwiches but I guess you're suppose to get full from all the beer they have on hand. I'm not much of a beer drinker but I really loved the Lemon Soda mixed with Beer. It was sweet but still had that grainy beer taste. It was perfect for those rare sunny sf days. It gets really crowded here and seating can get a bit tight. Nothing is more disappointing than having your food and drink orders come with no place to sit at. More benches and heartier portions would really make this spot perfect.
author: Charlie L.

description: post when your closed next time. saw multiple people trying to get in on may 19th with no information online or on your Facebook site
author: Keenan E.

description:
Since this city seems to have a huge lack of restaurants/bars with nice outdoor patios, this place is a little gem in my opinion. With giant tables (that are to be shared with strangers and friends alike) overlooking the small park in Hayes Valley, the Biergarten makes a perfect destination for a sunny afternoon.

After dark, they turn on the hanging lights above. This would give the place a romantic atmosphere, if it weren't for people shouting "chug, chug, chug!!!" around you. 

Yes, the line to the bar can get a little long, but use that time to make a new friends with some of the folks waiting there with you. Once you order, don't forget to grab a pretzel or bratwurst basket to go with your with a tasty beverage.
author: Kori M.

description: Great outdoor beer garden style place to drink delicious beers and eat delicious German food.  Picnic table style seating so chances are you'll be sharing a table with strangers given the limited seating.  The frankfurter on a pretzel roll was very tasty and my beer was excellent.  I felt like a warrior drinking from one of the liter steins.  The only downside, and it's a big one, is the wait time for a drink or a re-fill.  If you plan on having more than one drink, keep someone in line at all times because it took 30+ min to get our first drink and the line kept getting longer and longer.
author: Marcin M.

description: I am in love with the fact that a place like this exists.  It was so nice to walk up, order a fresh cold German beer and hang out with like minded folks.  Staff are super-friendly as well.  Be warned: shade is a limited commodity here.
author: Adam W.

description: My group of friends have been hyping up this place for a very long time and I finally had the chance to stop by this past Friday. In short, I was a bit underwhelmed by my experience at Biergarten. If you hate crowds as much as me, get ready to test your patience. I was lucky enough to secure a table for my group before the crowds started to form, but if you're not lucky, you're gonna be standing for your entire stay here. Beer here only comes in two sizes - half liters and liters, and the selection is quite poor. Food selection is also quite poor, but that wasn't a big deal to me since I normally just order beer and pretzels. My take on the pretzels? Subpar. You will find pretzels that are 10 times better than the ones here at Jamber. Random aside, but I do find it a bit comical that biergarten and smittens are right next to each other, as both places very much overhyped. What perfect neighbors! For happy hour, I would look elsewhere.
author: Austin W.

description:
Pretty impressed with Biergarten. The space is cool and reminds me of a slightly more antiseptic Zeitgeist. Their pretzels are very nice--warm and chewy but with a good taste. I'd imagine if I ate sausage they'd be pretty good too.

Taking credit cards is a big plus--though I wish they had a slightly larger selection of beers. There really don't have anything "big"--even the dark larger tastes more like a light ale than a porter.
author: Paul C.

description:
Beers, check.
Snacks, check.
Fun atmosphere and blankets for the city's chilly days, check.
author: Ashly d.

description:
Newly found gem for me, whoever created and opened this place is a genius.  

Pros:  Outside, simple, good german eats, good german beer

Cons:  Beer line can get very long and the beer selection is slim, unlike the full liter beers they serve!
author: Drew M.

description: The pork belly sliders are the best I have eaten anywhere in the world.  The selection of wine and the rest of the food is meh....
author: A J.

description:
When SF weather is favorable, this is an awesome place to hang out with friends + beers. It's lively, clean, and open. They have a limited food menu, but everything we tried was surprisingly delicious-- especially the cheese knot, egg salad, and pork sliders.

It may seem crowded, but people are always coming and going so getting a table just requires a little patience. There are also very clean restrooms for use. Heat lamps would be nice because it gets cold so quickly.
author: K V.

description: Great beer, great tapas on a sunny day. What else can you ask for? I suggest you wear warm clothes, it is San Francisco after all, some people bring blankets. This place can get pretty packed so be ready to stand and wait for tables to open up. But you can always eat ice cream or drink coffee next door.
author: Ennie L.

description: They need to expand. The wait is insane. Over an hour to get in and nowhere to sit, but was able to grab one of their blankets and sit on the ground with my friends. It's a great wonderful fabulous idea that should be all over the place. Every neighborhood in every major city should have this. But it should be at least twice as big. I promise everyone will be happier. Such a cool place.
author: Jessie M.

description:
Beer garden? Where's the grass? I've been to England where beer gardens are common and this is not a beer garden. I know this is a German beer garden, but is this how German's do it? 
The wait for beer is not worth it. 

If you want a beer garden Park Chalet is the place. You can lounge on the grass!
author: tina M.

description: Had to fend off reserving a whole table for a friend's birthday party from at least four different groups by myself while the others waited in the long line to get our drinks. Quite packed. At least we got liter size glasses to make up for it once they all arrived! Beer and cider were ehhh-okay, not worth my near-verbal sword fights for the table, though.
author: Garett T.

description: No better way to conclude a beautiful morning surf than a cold liter of bier and and a piping hot bratwurst. This fantastic little gem of a pub made my day. The food was excellent and atmosphere was superb (sunny, courteous bar-staff).  Lastly, the line was not outrageous at all.
author: Connor S.

description:
Didn't know about this place till my friend told me about it..always passed it while getting off the freeway at Octavia. 

It was a pretty nice day in San Francisco. Came to Biergarten right when it opened. There was a line already formed. One of the workers was checking ID's at the gate and giving everyone wristbands.  Ordered some beer I couldn't pronounce. 1 Liter for about $10. They had picnic tables all around. Pretty nice hangout spot to drink beer and chat
author: Christopher L.

description:
After being in the original Munich Oktoberfest twice, I got to say I really appreciate a good beergarden.

Good beer (but not a big selection), some interesting German snacks and joint tables for the ambiance.

Only missing ingredient is some German music, but obviously a no-go cause it's outside.
author: Assaf B.

description: Absolutely love this place! Its so random, but I guess that just makes it even better! The whole idea of sipping on huuuuuge beer mugs with your friends on picnic tables with cutesy lighting above is genius! Hahah it was freeeeezing the night we went but luckily they had blankets readily available to people for free! (: I didn't get to try much of the food but my friends said it was delicious! The beer was yummm as well! Perfect place to chill with some friends on a lazy afternoon!
author: Rachel G.

description:
There's not a lot I enjoy doing more on a lazy San Francisco afternoon than sitting back, enjoying the fresh air, and drinking. It didn't take a genius to decide that this kind of place might thrive in a place like Hayes Valley, but I applaud him nonetheless. 

There's plenty of tables, they've got a great location and on a nice day, this place is pretty close to perfect. But the wait can be long (or really long) and even with a beer, can get pretty bone-chillingly cold. If you can will yourself to look past that, you're golden!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I like the conecpt of drinking outside (admirer of Zeitgeist).  They do sell half and full liter beers at reasonalbe prices.  It's still new so expect to wait on long lines but the turnover is pretty fast so by the time you get a beer/food, there will be a place to sit.

I must say, after ordering food with our beer, the cost skyrocketed.  The food is very expensive for what you get.  For the cost of aONE bratwurst and some sauerkraut, you can buy 2 packages of Aidelle's sausages (I'm just sayin').

Despite my 2 star rating, I will go back for the beer and ambience - but I will eat first.
author: Jason P.

description: Beer was plentiful and the pretzels were awesome!  Only down side was a lack of wait staff and an abundance of bearded hipsters.  Cool out door spot in the city to go and chill with friends.
author: Carolyn P.

description: My favorite bar in SF, specially on a nice sunny afternoon. There is usually a longgg line but trust me, its worth the wait. Their bites are delicious. A bit pricy for the size but  they are delicious.
author: Maria C.

description:
Stupidly busy on nice days and they need to figure out a more efficient beer delivery system.

That being said, great atmosphere, great beer and the beet salad is to die for.
author: William W.

description:
A German beer garden is something of a novelty here in SF, which explains why it was so crowded on an overcast Saturday afternoon in March. 

If you can get past the crowds and grab a table then this is a pretty cool place to drink the day away. The beer is good (and comes in steins) and everybody seemed good natured and relaxed. Apparently the food is really good too.
author: J S.

description:
Tip: 1L of some good german beer, hoppen hef is a good one. 

This spot is really meant for a nice day. All outdoors with beers and food being served out of  old shipping containers. Nicely done. 

Went there for a quick beer but the weather was not so cooperative and quite cold so felt a bit rushed to drink quickly and get out of there. 

Didn't get a chance to try their food but perhaps next time.
author: Roth S.

description:
A nice little place by the park in Hayes Valley.

So if you like the taste of beer, don't get the one with Lemon Soda (Radler I believe), I thought it might be interesting but it was just a very smooth blue moonish like bear, very weak and not a very strong flavor at all. The other beers are better. If you want to avoid the taste of beer, then the Radler is a nice compromise.

Also, cash only + the beer won't get you drunk. It's the weakest stuff I've ever had.

Otherwise the Bratwurst and Sauerkraut are damn good. 

Try to grab some blankets.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Outside beer drinking? Yes please! it may cost you an extra dollar or two but their beers are excellent in my opinion, and it's right on a park. Love this spot, and the bread pudding w/side salad was delicious!!!!

check it out.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
On a spontaneous decision to check out Off the Grid-Proxy, we stumbled upon the gem Biergarten. After sampling the three beer selections, we chose our beers and sat down to share our tasty pork delights from Chairman Bao in addition to an order of bratwursts, sauerkraut and pretzel. 

It was a chilly night and I was grateful there were blankets to keep us toasty. As I dipped the chewy pretzel into the spicy mustard, I reflected that this is an ideal date place. After all, it's a non-pretentious outdoor dining where you feast on beer, sauerkraut, and sausages. Afterwards, if you are in the mood for something sweet, Smitten Ice Cream is right across the street where you have to opportunity to see liquid nitrogen at work.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Like the concept of this place and wished there were more spots like this in the city.  I don't however like the long beer lines. 

If you can beat the rush and are with a big group, this is a fun spot to chill on a sunny afternoon with some good bier.
author: Nho C.

description: Great place to hang out, but I wouldn't come here for either the beer or the food- both are just OK.
author: Karla R.

description: I wanted to like this place but in the end was disappointed. Over priced. Long lines. Hot beer. Hard to find a place to sit. Point blank - go somewhere else!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Update: 
Came back here, love the beer and bites, but the bouncer was a douche. 

Is this place even open?? I made plans with some friends to have a night out at Biergarten, checked the website for their hours...but when I got there they were closed! and no it was not raining.
author: katrina w.

description: Really fun place to go for beers on a nice fall SF day. The food is surprisingly really good. I did not expect that at all given that it's located in a chained up parking lot and seems to be more of a place to go for drinking than eating, but I was wrong! The only issue I have is that it's such a popular spot, the beer line can be very long and it's frequently hard to find a seat!
author: Jessie L.

description:
Went there for lunch on a really nice warm day - it was awesome. Friendly attentive people, simple and quick food, good beer - what else do you need from a beergarden?

BTW their pretzels are to die for - make sure to order one (or two :)
author: Ata N.

description:
I LOVE this place! It has been my new after-work spot since I moved here. Great atmosphere, very friendly service and great food. I think the beers are great and they swap out new ones every few days.
Honestly, who doesn't like a nice cold liter of beer on a Thursday after work?
author: Jessica R.

description: Really fun vibe! ! You really feel like you're at an outdoor pub in Germany. The food was fantastic. The sliders were literally the best sliders I've ever had. Pretzel was good, the horseradish was a nice compliment. Seating is limited and although the wait wasn't bad when we went at 5pm, the line was super long as I was leaving. Had the cider beer which was delish and heard no complaints about the others on tap as well. Definitely will be back.
author: Cassidy D.

description: Don't go here unless you like to wait 45-60 min for your first and perhaps only beer. Poorly planned and executed. I waited over an hour (out of stubborn determination I guess) for one beer then would have had to wait another hour for a second round since they have no wait staff. I couldn't understand why it should take so long. Basically they have a monopoly on nice weather otherwise one would see it's just a parking lot selling $14 Stellas. Don't waste your time.
author: Mitch G.

description:
Don't like hipsters? Don't go to the Biergarten. Instead, move to Stockton and stop complaining. If you're less concerned about the appearance of your servers and fellow customers, read on:

The food is great, albeit expensive. The bier is terrific (also expensive). Show up with eyes open about the cost, enjoy the company of your group instead of complaining about the line and you'll have a great time.
author: Ryan T.

description:
I. Love. This. Place. 

The first night I moved to San Francisco, my friends and I were exhausted from lugging furniture all day and decided to check out the neighborhood.  After a hearty meal at Patxi's, we stumbled upon the cute public space and were drawn to the twinkling lights above the Biergarten.  I've been back several times ever since.

I've tried a few of their beers (the selection isn't vast, so this isn't difficult), and my favorite is their Schneider Weisse.  I've taken every person that's visited me to this beer garden, shared seeded pretzels, pickles, and the occasional pretzel-wich, and had many great afternoons here.  It's a shame this place closes so early (especially on Sundays), but it's completely understandable based on the neighborhood and outdoor location.  Make sure to dress warmly, and keep an eye out for the friendly staff that come by with cozy blankets at night!
author: Amy C.

description: I came here with some friends on a late Saturday afternoon, and it was packed! Biergarten definitely feels like a German beer garden. All of the bartenders were very welcoming and nice, which was a delightful change from most of the bars I've been to. I ordered a Schneider Weisse, which came in an attractive, slender, and tall glass, and it tasted just right. The ambience was conducive to fun and relaxing drinking. My friends and I sat in the den behind the bartenders' counter, which had some dim lights, perfect for making you feel a bit tipsy even after one beer. I would definitely come back again with friends!
author: Carson T.

description: This is such a great idea!  Outdoor socializing with beer and snacks.  On cold days/nights, they offer blankets to keep you nice and warm.  I've been here a couple times.  The first time I came here, they had a german band in costume which was pretty cool.  They offer a nice selection of beer on tap and some in bottle and a good selection of snacks.  You can choose either a 1/2 Liter or 1 Liter of beer.  As for snacks, I especially love the pretzel.  It's warm and soft and served with mustard.  Perfect combo with a nice glass of Schneider Weisse.  The second time I came here, the pretzel/bread maker happened to be on vacation so we were pretty bummed.  Hopefully the next time I visit, there will be pretzels with my beer!
author: Charlene P.

description: Bratwurst dog was excellent. I had some shandy type of drink which was nice. Of course if you go on a sunny day, lines will be long and there isn't always a place to sit. Still the service is good.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Great place to grab a beer on a sunny day.  The line gets long for beer...like 20 minute wait long...and it is the only line you can purchase the beer from.  I suggest ordering the large beers!
author: Nic S.

description: At three p.m. on a Friday, the place was hopping.  The special frankfurter was amazing (with a special apple slaw).  Hefeweisen on tap, and all is right with the world.
author: Laurel B.

description:
i think i'm obligated to give the biergarten at least 4 stars just because of it's sheer proximity to me (2 blocks away). come here with a friend or 5, grab a beer, grab a blanket, laugh at the guy in the pink polo shirt and neon green shades. or not. that's the beauty of it all--you're outside in the best city in the world having a beer with some friends, do whatever you want. what could be better?

this place just makes you feel a bit optimistic about everything, despite what some may view as setbacks:

- limited beer selection = who cares, there is still beer, and all of it is good!
- it's cold outside = they have wool blankets!
- the obnoxious hipsters/scenesters/____ group you don't identify with = come with your own friends and ignore them!

see, everything is great at the biergarten! (disclaimer: may take a beer or 2 to agree with all of the above).
author: stefanie h.

description: So busy but so good!!! Best beer and German bites! Mein Liblingsbiergarten!!!!!
author: Erin H.

description: My favorite bar in sf. Great beer and sausage on a sunny afternoon. Now that's hard to beat!
author: Guillaume B.

description:
Having just returned from a trip to Oktoberfest in München I am glad to find a place serving authentic flair with good beer. 

The people are real, the beer is fresh and cold, and the neighborhood is friendly. 

Since this is my first review I don't have much to compare to...but if you're looking for a place that's more about who you're with than where you're at (anywhere in the world). This is a great spot!
author: Rob C.

description: it's raining but who cares when you are at a fun beer garden right in the middle of Hayes valley. What a great idea. Outdoor seating with umbrellas on most tables and warm blankets just in case you need one. We ordered the bratwurst basket which includes 2 bratwurst, sauerkraut and a soft pretzel. Oh and yummy pork belly sandwiches (2 mini to an order)! Oh and of course a Black Logger! I feel like I'm in Germany! Extra plus, I love the friendly staff. Oh yes, they are so well equipped... outdoor kitchen and there are even very clean outdoor bathrooms (after all that beer!).
author: Jay S.

description: Let me just put it this way: no beer is worth an hour wait in line.  The food was good, but mostly heavy german style dishes with a lot of sausage and the like.  Sure the beer was good, but definitely not worth having to fight for a table, standing in line for literally an hour, and paying a premium for all of it to boot.  I won't be back.
author: Claire L.

description: If you are lucky enough to get a seat and a beer without waiting for an hour in line, then this is a great place on a sunny day.  However if you show up and see a line, then it's a tough call since it can take a while to get through...but the beers are tasty and there are expanding the menu there.
author: Dilly M.

description: the place rules. plain and simple. owner is always around and bearded. the nice woman behind the bar is always polite and on-the-ball. it's a great vibe. It's a long line, but it does go fast.
author: Jubilee D.

description:
It really pains me to give this rating, but my girlfriend and I both got sick after eating here. We had an order of pickles and a pretzel while waiting in line, and later the sausages and sauerkraut. I'm guessing it was the latter that did us in. This is such a shame, because the food was surprisingly good. Fortunately, it was not too bad, and neither of us missed work.

Had it not been for the incident with the food, I'd give this place 3.5 stars, maybe 4. The biggest problem is the lines. I don't mind waiting to get into the place (the guy at the door (the owner?) was really friendly and helpful), but you have to go back into that long line to order another beer, as there is no table service nor a separate line for customers already inside. I'd also deduct a 1/2 star for lack of variety. They had Schneider Weisse (yay!), but the other two beers were ok. The Radler is way too sweet for me, but that's a personal preference I suppose. Those were the only options the day we were there.

So my take on this place? If you don't mind the lines, this is a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. The communal outdoor benches are great. I'll personally avoid the food, but might be back for a beer. With Schmidt's and Walzwerk not far away, however, I might just go to one of those places to get a better selection of beer.
author: Brett L.

description: Feels as if I am back in Munich at a bier garden. Great vibe and beer. We actually walked over here while waiting for our table Suppenküche. Will definitely be back soon to try some of the food, the pretzels were amazing.
author: Ryan M.

description: It's a shame that dogs are not allowed in an outdoor beer garden. Totally ridiculous.
author: Captain B.

description: Had to wait in line for about 40 minutes but it was well worth it. The banana knot, pretzel with banana, hazelnut butter and honey was delicious. Very enjoyable with a larger group of people on a sunny day.
author: Antonio V.

description: Love the Biergarten! Great Beer and snacks. I love coming here for a drink, such a cool atmosphere and the cargo bins just work!
author: Jessica M.

description: I enjoyed everything about this place. Sure the food and beer add up but you are outside in a decent neighborhood and if you have good friends around you the money doesn't matter. First off liter sized beers, OK! Amazing bratwurst and sauerkraut, GREAT! When it gets chilly the wool blankets come out, PERFECT! Overall yes the bill added up but the atmosphere and friends around with good beer and food to choose from this is a place that I will recommend to others.
author: Jena V.

description: Great atmosphere, great beers, great food and an awesome place to go on a warm day. Keep in mind that it opens at 3 pm and make sure to get there by about 2:45 if you want a table. The menu is pretty limited but everything we ordered was great... I loved the beet salad and the pretzel. Definitely will head back on a nice day!
author: Gina C.

description: Beer + outside + pretzels = why havent you been yet?? If you're still hungry, stop by Suppernkuche up the street!
author: Nathan B.

description: This place is pretty rad! A little pop up beer garden in the middle of the neighborhood. I dig it! Long lines, but serving large steins of beer out of shipping containers is awesome in it's own right. Big tables, kids, dogs and lots of people. Will definitely be back!
author: B S.

description:
A nice beer garden right in Hayes Valley. Plenty of picnic-style tables. Great beer selection and the German food is excellent as well. Come with a big group of friends and grab some steins! 

Weekday afternoons are far less crowded than weekends. The beers that they have as specials get pretty expensive.
author: Kevin G.

description:
great place to spend a sunny day, but be prepared to wait in a long ass long for drinks!

they have radlers here and huge steins of beer, so it's pretty amazing.  if you go on a thurs night, off the grid is there too!
author: Helen T.

description: No beer is worth the wait this place has. Te slowest beer in San Francisco. Saturday is about a 2 hour wait for a beer.
author: Conor B.

description:
love the atmosphere!!!! outdoor drinking with blankets and lights.  

I can't pronounce or spell the beers we got but let's just say the place is a beer lover paradise. The food was pretty good too!!! 

yes the pretzel is just as good as the other reviews say it is.  so must get something with their pretzel in it!!!!!
author: JY L.

description: I really like this place! Is it weird that I'd like to have my wedding reception here? Love the layout--it's really, as everyone says, an old parking lot, and you order your beer/food in like a trailer. you have a wide selection of beers and some are in a 0.5 or 1 liter so come on an empty stomach. there's a decent selection of food--definitely try the pretzel, cheese knot, anything pretzel-related. this would be great on a warm sunny day, but i would alsoo like to come at night because they have super cute light bulbs hanging across.
author: Veronica L.

description:
The concept is perfect: an outdoor place to sit and drink beer. 
The execution, however, needs work.
We waited in line for 20 minutes and when we got to the front some guy just tried to cut in line. I was already hot on this unsual 80 degree day in SF so when someone tried to circumvent the natural order of the line, I was pissed. I called him out on his violation of common decency and he reluctantly went to the end of the line. My fellow patrons appreciated my assertiveness and we moved forward. However, NOT WITHOUT TWO MORE PEOPLE TRYING TO CUT IN LINE. AND THE GUY CHECKING ID's JUST LET THIS SHIT HAPPEN! When I hassled him about it he just said "look man we just opened and still trying to figure things out."
So apparently "figuring things out" means "I'm going to pretend that the line is important until someone challenges the integrity of the line and then lie down." 
I'm a reasonable guy so I can say with certainty that this place was pretty cool. The beer was your standard good german beer and the food was delicious. Like I said, the concept is perfect but the people can seriously ruin it. If the employees and patrons are douches, I won't want to go back. And when San Franciscans are stereotyped as being about equal rights and fairness, its pretty damned irritating to watch them step on other people to get to the front of a line for beers.
author: Andy W.

description: It was a cold day to be walking around in San Francisco.  This little spot on Octavia is actually housed in a shipping container -- how trendy, right?  But they provided me with a tasty pasture-raised pork bratwurst, kraut, and a hot cup of mulled wine, all of which made it tolerable to huddle at one of their outdoor tables for lunch.  The menu is small -- beer, sausages, a few things for the vegetarians.  Focus on one thing, do it well. I will definitely come back to see if it's still here the next time I'm in town.
author: Cynthia G.

description: The lines are quite long, and the prices for beer aren't great.  Overall though, its a nice change from your dark, loud bar, and a great way to spend a nice day with friends.  Gather up your favorite people and go enjoy some sunlight.  Yay vitamin D! And beer, Yay beer!
author: Yan L.

description: Decent selection of beers and friendly staff to tell you about each. It can get really crowded, but is definitely worth waiting for on a sunny day.
author: Brett B.

description: Greatest idea ever. San Francisco needed more outdoor drinking establishments.
author: Brian D.

description:
My first review on Yelp.
I found this place while going to Suppenkuche about a block away and I saw all the tables and people drinking those giant steins of beer and I was immediately intrigued. I just had to go there to see for myself.
We stood in line for about 20 minutes because they were controlling the flow of people going into the area and making sure it wasn't getting crowded near the bar and food service stations. The wait was well worth it minus the fact that they were out of 3/6 beers they had available. Given it is the end of Oktoberfest, they should have been more prepared especially since it was only about 6pm and they opened at 3pm earlier that day.
All that aside, I got myself a monster stein of Paulander Oktoberfest and I loved it. It's a pretty malty beer with slight hops, its an amber ale so expect it to be a little richer than a pilsner but less than a brown ale. Overall a great beer, although it's only in season during Oktoberfest.
I'd definitely go here again because the ambiance and good vibes are worth it.
author: David L.

description: Fun outdoor seating with big beers and pretty good food.  I had the Hef and ordered the bratwurst with potatoes and it was a great time.  Went a little later in the evenings and it gets kinda chilly but they have blankets there for you if you need them.  Fun spot to bring a group a friends.
author: Eric M.

description: I had the spooky October Frankenstein special-It was delicious.  German drinking tables = double vassup
author: Peter R.

description: Bad bartender! Ordered a New castle on draft and I received a rancid rancid beer! No fizz and tasted like vinegar. Apperently they're coolers were down but a bartender should know if a beer pours flat something something is wrong. Most spoiled beer beers ever ever had! She brought my friend one a couple rounds later (I switched to bottles). The The capper was she insulted my friend after all this! No more Biergarten! Hire competent staff and and fix your coolers! Rancid beer, no excuse!
author: Jos W.

description: Yummo!  Had a liter of Pils, the lardo on brown bread (sublime!), the charctuerie on a pretzel knot (perfectly salty) and a pretzel with mustard and horseradish (just the right chew) and a just-right pickle.  Sitting outside with great food and a lot of beer on a beautiful and sunny San Francisco day is about as good as it gets.  The wait was well worth it and the location perfect for people watching (most were actually watching us inside the fence....)
author: Susan F.

description:
Spent a lot of time standing in line for a beer whilst discussing San Franciscans predilection for standing in lines. Some places in this fair city are worth the wait -- Tartine and Bi-Rite Creamery come to mind -- but Biergarten is not one of them. While those other establishments create a product that is simply superior to other offerings in the city, Biergarten serves a limited selection of mediocre beer (it is German, after all) and good (not great) food. Special shout out to the delightfully pickled deviled eggs, and the pretzels are legit, but it's tough to justify some of the prices for the other menu items.

I do really like the aesthetic of this place. Some people might get turned off because they feel like they're drinking beer in what amounts to a glorified parking lot, but I think it has an inviting, urban park charm. It benefits from a thoughtful, modern industrial architecture where the kitchen, bar, and bathrooms are all built in giant gray shipping containers (very cool), the tables are simple and sturdy, and the openness of the space affords ample people watching. 

But man, that line! Would you go to a bar if I told you that you had to wait thirty minutes every time you wanted another beer? I doubt it. The food is better than the beers at this place, and the food line is generally short and easy to navigate, but you want your beer to keep flowing if you're settling in for an afternoon at a place like this, and it just doesn't. Some reviewers think it's a glaring operational problem, but I'm quite sure the management likes it the way it is. Why would they feel the need to change their service style if there is a never ending 30+ minute line full of patrons willing to wait it out? It undoubtedly creates turnover at the tables and helps to keep customers drunkenness levels in check. 

I love outdoor day drinking as much as the next guy, and there is obviously serious demand at this place. I just think I'll take my talents to someplace like Zeitgest or Lucky 13 instead and head back to order my second (much tastier) beer from the bar as quickly as it would take you to get one less flavorful offering from Biergarten. That line is for suckers.
author: Justin L.

description: The Hayes Valley biergarten is a great place to spend a sunny day.  Get there early to beat the huge crowds, and pay attention to the somewhat odd hours they keep.  Afterwards, Hayes Valley is a pleasant neighborhood to walk around in.
author: Dan W.

description: We were visiting San Francisco and it was a particularly nice Friday afternoon with plenty of sunshine so this place sounded perfect. Plenty of seating, lively crowd, great pretzels, and most importantly, very good beer. I wish there was a place like this in LA cuz this is where it's at.
author: Matt R.

description: a German Biergarten is always a good thing! There are too many long lines to get in and order beer, but both go pretty fast. The very cool red beard bouncer either said "go find the good looking people" or "you are good looking people", either way, everyone in here looks pretty happy and good looking. The pretzels are great and the friend making group tables are a lot of fun. I was pretty cold though, maybe they are pre heat lamp operated?
author: Laura F.

description: Beer, burgers, & sunshine. What more could you ask. Organic, well-crafted high quality food as well. Expect a line on sunny days though.
author: Blake N.

description: Great beer selection, can get cold. Looking forward to trying their food.
author: Raymond H.

description: Good, cold German beer, outdoors in the sunshine?  What could be better?  My only gripe - the lengthy wait to actually get a beer...45 minutes!  But at the end it was definitely worth it...just make sure you get enough to tide you over, unless you want to get back in line and wait to get the second round.
author: Drew W.

description: Beirgarten is located in a friendly neighborhood, the place is surrounded by a fence in outer space. There is no actual building, but I love the lively atmosphere.
author: Daichi S.

description: I stopped by for my regular radler and a knot, and discovered they have a cheese knot! It has caramelized onions as well, which really compliments the flavor of the cheese - it leaves it tasting very sweet (this coming from a person that hates onions.)
author: T M.

description: Nice place to hang out and have a nice cold beer. However, there's always a line and can get very crowded. Also, you will get burnt since they don't have any shades or you will freeze because they don't have one of those oversized outside heater. Not very accommodating. Perhaps once you've had a glass or two, you won't really care anymore. One thing, I love their pretzels!
author: J C.

description: My boyfriend heard of Biergarten from his brother and confirmed it with one of the servers at Suppenküche. We came here the weekend of my birthday. Although there was quite a line, it wasn't too bad of a wait. The prices are still just as high here, even their bar food was a bit pricey. However, I enjoyed their beer and of course enjoyed my company, my PIC and drinking buddy. Cannot wait to bring my friends here!
author: Jamie L.

description: Pricey small dishes (open-face egg sandwich, bratwurst). Good place to chill with beer and friends on a sunny day.
author: Inigo M.

description: Really?? They serve beer in a parking lot void of any personality.  Your dog is not allowed on their outdoor parking lot and they recommend that you tie your dog up on the city sidewalk so you can see them through the chain link fence.  So lame.
author: K W.

description: Stopped here in May for a beer and a hot pretzel. Both were great. My main complaint was that they ran out of pretzels while we were there. It got quite chilly and a pretzel would have helped stave off the cold. They do have some heavy woolen blankets you can used to huddle up as it gets cold. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would give 4.5 stars if I could.
author: Lea D.

description: I love the idea and concept but massive lines and fighting for seating when it get packed is frustrating. It gets packed on every sunny day which is awesome for business and I get you can't really expand but waiting for 20/30 minutes for a 8-14 beer can convince people to move. Still enjoy stopping by every so often.
author: Dave B.

description: Awesome!!! Seriously felt like I was in Germany. I had the wheat beer and we shared some food: a regular pretzel, sunflower pretzel, and the pork belly sliders. All the food was yummy and they have specials every day too. Really diligent staff that was always walking around picking up empty glasses, food trays, and offering blankets. What a cool concept. This is a good place to take visitors.
author: Katie P.

description: Can't go wrong here... Great beer of course. Just the right temperature. They have a liter of beer and it's humongous!  The outdoor patio is perfect to meet new people especially after a few beers. I've tried different variations of wurst and they're all delicious. Next time I'll be tried the sliders or the burger. Great place to hang out in Hayes especially in good Indian Summer days in SF!
author: Rob L.

description: It may be hard to snag a place to sit at times, and the beer selection is somewhat limited (4-5 beers on tap), but when the weather and company are right, this place is the damn haps.  They even give out free cookies while you're waiting in line.
author: Jenn C.

description: For all you "bier" lovers out there...you must check it out...but it is soooo crowded you should try to get there earlier....it you get tired of waiting in line...tell the person in front you'll be right back and go over to get some ice cream from Smitten first....that will tie you up until the line moves....a great neighborhood for showing out of towners too...
author: Mee-stique K.

description: After circling the neighborhood for a good 30 mins to find parking, seeing the line to get the beer was ridiculous. But I'm glad to say it was worth the wait. I was very surprised to see the only 2 sizes the beers came in, .5L and 1L but they were well worth it for the price.  We tried the haufbrau, octoberfest, and one other one, grabbed a few pretzels and chatted the afternoon away with some new friends we made at one of the picnic tables. Really wanted to give the bratwurst a try because they smelled amazing but we had to save room for dinner. Overall, great atmosphere and a great place to hang out with friends and meet new ones.
author: Sarah L.

description: Beer, brats and blankets to keep you warm. Great spot. Food was good and who doesn't like a liter of cola...I mean beer. Only minus- can't bring the dogs in.
author: Johanna S.

description: I love the idea of this place- a casual outdoor bar where you can grab some drinks and small things to eat and just hang out- but it's always so insanely crowded! I'm always in the mood to go to Biergarten, but then I see the line wrapping around the gates and I end up ditching that plan and going somewhere else. If you do manage to secure a table at Biergarten- first of all, congratulations. That's amazing. Secondly- yes, the prices are a bit steeper than one what expect for an outdoor bar, but the beers are good, the service is quick, and the pork belly sliders are delicious! Also- don't even think of driving here because you'll have better odds of winning the lottery than you will finding a parking spot in Hayes Valley. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars, because the negative aspects of Biergarten (like the wait,crowds, lack of parking) are not really specific to the bar, but to the neighborhood itself. So count this as 3 1/2 stars.
author: Kate C.

description: The space is great but the beers on tap are limited.  With only 3 beers to choose from, I was disappointed.  I love german beers and wanted to see a variety, so that gives this establishment only 3 stars.
author: Yen T.

description: The food was tasty, the beer was good. The food took forever and *DISCLAIMER* there was no warning for how tiny the food is. I got a pretzel sandwich and my friend got a veggie burger... HA! What a joke. They looked like things that should be served at a tapas place... Not filling at all and despite its tastiness, not worth the money/the wait.
author: Dominic D.

description: What a fun place, especially for an outdoorsy like me! Do anticipate a line on the weekend for this fun little shack. Once you get to the front the hostess will let you try a few of the brews on tap, hopefully you'll opt for the big stein like I did :) They also serve wine and lite bites, but given the title I think beer is the way to go. They'll have something for everyone's beer taste buds from dark to light. It's a little lot but man do they know how to utilize what little amount of space they have, it's San Francisco so go figure! There's a bunch of picnic tables for you to sit at with friends with lights that they have strung over head for when it gets darker, there's something about those lights that makes sitting out more magical. Even on a beautiful day like when we came, the staff still came around with blankets, how accommodating! I wish there were more places like these in San Jose!
author: Karen L.

description: Have wanted to go to this place for awhile now, and finally went yesterday, when the weather was beautiful out.  Unfortunately, too many people had the same idea.  The place had a good vibe and good beer, but the line to get beer was very long -- it took more than half an hour to get to the front of the line -- and while we were in line, we found out that they were out of pretzels!  This was around 5:30, and they're only open from 2-8, so that was quite disappointing.  Because of the long line, we only got one round of beers, because we didn't want to wait again.  That's not really the feeling you want when you go out to grab some beers (plural).
author: Pilan C.

description: I went on a Wednesday evening, and the line was not long at all. Had some good beer and German food. I can't complain. Also, the atmosphere and lighting are great as it gets dark out
author: adrian b.

description: I've been there three times now and this place is HAPPENING!!!! I love the outdoor seating! You get a blankie too if it gets too cold and the long tables will help you make new friends easily.  Beer, beer, and more beer is all I can say! It's always crowded and lively! Such a fun spot to go to with a group of friends! It will def make you feel like you're in Germany!
author: Heidi K.

description: I've only been here once but this place is pretty cool. It's set outdoors so there's plenty of space. There's a bunch of benches everywhere so there's plenty of seating for people as well. I got the big glass of beer and it was pretty good, unfortunately i have no idea what i ordered (haha noob -____-"). I had to just ask the worker behind the counter to give me some recommendations and i pointed to it and said "that one". the workers were nice, no one bothers you, and the environment is really chill. it's just somewhere you can sit down, relax, talk and have a good time. I didn't order any food so i can't really comment, but i saw a lot of food orders being taken..maybe i'll try it next time heh~
author: Hannah K.

description: So I live a block away from this place and have had every opportunity to come here. I like the beer, the food and the people. However every time I come here I get the feeling that I would rather be indoors. Why? Because it's cold in this area. This beer garden is only open in the evenings during the week and it's placed at the bottom of the hill which practically becomes a wind tunnel. It can be absolutely miserable at times. Yes they hand out blankets, but how can you hold a stein, a bratwurst AND a little blanket and not begin to question ... why the hell am I sitting out here? I would rather just go to Suppenküche indoors where it is warm and the same super nice people are too. I know it's about being seen and people watch, but I don't need that. I can go to the park and grab a hot coffee if I want that. I usually only come for the novelty when showing friends around the neighborhood at this point. Even though it is not one of my regular spots in the neighborhood, it is at least worth a try.
author: Greg G.

description: This place has great beers on tap, and some decent food. The lines can be ridiculous, however. It is a great place to spend a warm Saturday afternoon!
author: P K.

description: Three words.  Pork. Belly. Sliders!  I'm not a beer drinker, so this review is based on those sliders.  DE-LISH!  I'll admit they're smaller than I'm used to for sliders, and the price isn't well, let's just say I could probably buy an entree elsewhere for the price of the sliders.  BUT!  So worth trying them.  Hats off to the chef!
author: E J.

description: I'm torn about this place: I love it deeply and hate it even more so at the same time. I love it because it is one of the few places in SF where you can enjoy a beer outside, weather permitting. I hate it because it takes an hour standing in line to get said beer and, only if you're extremely lucky, get a seat on a bench. I will give it 4 stars for now because it really is a nice way to spend a day outside but that's not really their accomplishment; more so the accomplishment of moody SF weather and lack of other outside drinking places.
author: Artyom C.

description: 1 liter Radler (shandy), huge bratwurst, kraut, mustard .. so awesome. There's not much protection from the heat or cold (it's SF the weather changes quickly) but this place is great. It's first come first serve, order at the counter and then sit at communal picnic tables. Be ready to wait it's usually pretty busy here and for good reason.
author: Mark R.

description: Great place for a drink and a bite to eat with friends.   After we ordered and sat down, I felt like I was back in Berlin.  I love this they have all German beers on tap available in 0.5L or 1L mugs.  And the pretzel was also yummy.
author: Courtney J.

description: This place was so trendy and I was actually expecting something better. You need to wait a long line to have beer. There are few pretzel like things to eat -- not great. Nice to sit and drink outdoors but there are lots of other places you can do that. There is not much special about this place.
author: Siddika P.

description:
this place was just ok.  was really excited to try it out, but i wasn't too impressed.  they didn't have too many beers to choose from.  why not just go to zeitgeist down the way?

also, we ordered this lemonade/beer concoction...  we thought it would be lemony... but really it ended up just tasting super sweet.  gross.  after just a couple sips we knew we didn't want any more and would be just trying to choke it down.  so, we took the beers back and asked for something else.  one of the people behind the counter looked appalled.. the other just looked extremely uncomfortable.  ummm, ok?  we just didn't like our drink, is that so weird?  because of the discomfort, while she was pouring our next beer, we said we could pay for the ones we didn't drink and we got a nervous laugh in response.  as we sat and drank our second beers, we wondered if we would actually be charged for the two beers we only took a sip of.  when we got our check, yup, we got charged for them.  seriously?  they couldn't just leave off the two *draft* beers we didn't drink?  most places, would just give you a  freebie.  i was pretty surprised.  i mean, they couldn't even have maybe left *one* of the beers off?!  in the end, we paid 30$ plus tip for just two beers.  honestly, if they had even say, given us 5$ off or *any* kind of gesture, i would have felt better.  but no.
author: vlad k.

description: You will have a ton of fun here. I had to go check it out, because I walked past it every day and was so intrigued by their gigantic beers. You sit in a big group, most likely with strangers, but every one is super nice! If you go later in the day, dress warm, it gets cold, although, I do believe they offer blankets here too!
author: Emily B.

description: Biked over to this place on a sunny day and had a blast.  The beer is as authentic as the food and setting.  Well done Biergarten!
author: Doug S.

description: Great place to chill with friends and grab a drink on a nice SF weekend afternoon. Good soft pretzels and decent selection of beers. A place like this has been much needed in Hayes Valley and it's finally here!
author: Lina L.

description: Great beer, food, and space.  But the beer line... probably close to 45 minutes at some point, are you kidding me!?  They need to pare down the selection on crowded days to one light, one dark, and one wheat beer.  Go all cash, or have a separate bar back who is processing credit cards.  And, have the food orders separate from the beer orders.  Prost!
author: Andrei A.

description:
let me echo the thoughts of others: this place has great potential! beer is delicious, but pretzels do cost a bit too much ($4).  no reason also why the beer staffers could not add more people behind the bar to keep the line down.

other that that, though, really nice experience!  especially when it gets warmer, this place will be hot!
author: sean m.

description: New favorite place to go with friends on those rare sunny sf days.
author: around town e.

description: The concept is really cool and you really want to like it, but the line is ridiculous. We waited over an entire hour in line just to get beer. There are "wait staff" walking around but seems like they only deliver food and clean up, they do not deliver beer which is a huge miss for this location. If the wait staff were allowed to deliver beer people would be more inclined to hang around. It seems like over half the line got tired of waiting and just left (big loss of business for this location). The bar staff was extremely nice. We tried to host a birthday party here on a pretty weather day, but it was really hard to get people to stay because of the lines. We also tried to contact the management 3 times to this location and no one ever returned our calls (big disappointment) even if just to tell us they don't take reservations. As we live in the neighborhood, we really want this spot to be successful and think it should cater more to locals in the neighborhood. Good luck with this location as we're probably not coming back until the service and lines get better. We really want you to be successful in a way that it keeps us wanting to come back and bring other people into our super cool neighborhood.
author: Brent T.

description: Great location and great venue.  Beer is german - so really good Lager / Pilsner type of beers.  The ability to get additional beers is challenging.  The line was out the front gate and once you were in you had to go all the way to the back of the line along with the people that weren't even in the property yet!  They should have two lines - one for new customers and one for existing customers already in the joint.
author: Nick F.

description: this place really knows what's what. the focus is on quality beers, food, and service, and it really delivers. today we drank huge beers under umbrellas while the rain pounded Hayes, and it was a ridiculously fine experience. the staff even brought us freebie pretzel thingies for sticking it out! can't ask more from a Biergarten. don't need to lust after visiting Munchen any more.
author: Jason P.

description: the staff here sucks. at least on the night i came with my cousin and the place was empty. (1/18 or 1/19)  i'm sure its a little more reasonable to be a bit short and snide when the place is packed and its super busy but on a quiet night, be nice!! the person pouring my beer was fine, but the ladies patrolling around the place like it was a catholic school playground was obnoxious. i was scared my hand was gonna get slapped with a ruler if i didn't drink my beer fast enough. it was 7:30 and I ordered a beer and pretzel, my 20 year old cousin had a non alcoholic lemonaid. i had no idea they closed at 8 pm, just arrived from nyc. maybe you should tell me as i order my beer, just so you know we are closing soon but please enjoy your beer. i pulled out a napkin and an extra one fell on the table. lady comes over and fixes the display. really? i am half way through my pretzel and lady comes by and the napkin stand with utensils is taken away. my pretzel is finished- which tastes excellent, but i am still eating those yummy seeds that fell off and she takes away my basket. don't touch my plate!! ugh!! i would come again if it was amazing sunny day and it was so crowded i wouldnt notice the attitude that exudes from the ladies on staff. lighten up and let people enjoy its a freakin beer garden!
author: Kristen F.
